text: Shifts a collection of projectiles along physically accurate projectile paths.

This SOP takes as input a geometry which is a collection of projectiles to be launch, a motion path to edit/extend, the position of the projectiles at the start of their paths, and the position of the projectiles at the end of their paths. It then uses these start and end positions, along with its parameters, to construct trajectories along which to launch the projectiles.

input is a valid motion path, then the projectile motion will be inserted into this path with a smoothed region at the beginning and end of the projectile motion. A valid motion path is a collection of points with
attributes, such as those that can be outputted by the
attribute is provided, it will be interpretted as the instantaneous velocity at each point on the path.

The parameters for this node provide controls for how to define the paths including specifying the period over which the projectiles should fly and the maximum height that the projectiles should reach.
The output of the node can either be the paths along which the projectiles will fly or the projectiles having been shifted so that their centers of mass follow their paths.
geometry that are partitioned into projectiles to be launched.
geometry will be launched as a single projectile or partitioned into many projectiles based upon a

geometry will be treated as a single projectile and only one path will be created.
        The
input is only used while in this mode.
input does not need to be set to create the path.
One trajecory will be created for each piece of the

When on, specifies the name of the partition point or primitive attribute that defines the pieces, where each point or primitive with the same attribute value is considered part of the same piece. Partition attributes can only be integers or strings. If a

is not provided, then each point will be considered as its own piece.
    Each piece of the
geometry repesents a separate projectile to launch. When attributes are used to declare the properties of the trajectory, they will be obtained from the first point of each piece.
If the geometry contains both point and primitive piece attributes, then point attribute will be chosen.
When using a primitive attribute, if a point is assinged to multiple pieces and
, the point will move with the first of the projectiles that it is assigned to.

The rate at which to generate point samples along the trajectories.

Steps how many times to divide the trajectories into further segments.
    Higher values will generate more points along the curve. A value of 1 should
    be sufficient to resolve the curve. If you want to apply post-deformation,
    increase the

to ensure there are enough points to properly
    capture the deformation.

If on, any portion of the input
after the end of the projectile motion will be shifted in world space to follow from its end.
If on, any portion of the input
before the beginning of the projectile motion will be shifted in world space so that it ends at the start of the trajectory.
Whether to use linear, constant, or hermite interpolation when interpolating between points on the input
Whether to use linear, constant, or hermite interpolation when interpolating between the trajectory and the input
Number of frames before/after the start of the projectile motion to remove before creating a smooth transition region.
Number of frames before/after the end of the projectile motion to remove before creating a smooth transition region.
These parameters manage the physical properties of the projectiles such as mass, drag, and gravity.

The dictionary or float point attribute on the input geometries which defines the mass on each point.
        If it is a dictionary attribute, the
key will define the mass. Additionally, the
key can be used to define a local center of mass for each point.
The total mass of each projectile. This reduces the effect

has upon the projectiles' motion.
        If the

defines the mass of the points, it will be used instead of this parameter.
        Otherwise, if the
point attribute, its values will be used for the mass of the points instead of this parameter.

Sets the air resistance for the projectiles. Higher values will result in a faster loss of energy and a shorter travel distance. A drag of zero will produce a symmetric arc.
        If the
point attribute, its value will be used instead of this parameter.
Sets the force that attracts the projectiles towards the ground. Set all components to zero if you want straight paths that are not affected by gravity.

Specifies the condition which triggers an end to the projectile motion.

or 'hplaneN' point attribute, its value will be used instead of this parameter. If both attributes are present, the

When on, each projectile motion will end the first time it collides with the end plane.
        Otherwise, if a projectile would collide with the end plane twice, it will end the second time it collides with the plane.
This parameter is only used when the projectile would cross the target plane twice.
These parameters manage what attributes exist on the output geometry.
Multiplier applied to the exported velocity point attribute (
Creates a point attribute storing the path number of each projectile, starting at 0. This can serve as an ID attribute in case points are subsequently shuffled or removed.
Creates a point attribute storing the number of points for each curve.
This parameter is only available when the
Creates a point attribute storing the point number index with respect to its path. The first point on each path will have a value of 0.
This parameter is only available when the
Creates a point attribute storing the speed at the start of the projectile’s trajectory.
Creates a point attribute storing the end time of the projectile’s trajectory.
Creates a point attribute storing the relative time of the projectile along its trajectory where the start of the trajectory is 0 and the end of the trajectory is 1.
motion path mode, this creates a point attribute that stores the time at which to evaluate the
input to ensure that the animation before and after the

occurs before and after the projectile motion.
        If the
input also contains this input, that timeline will be warped instead of the deafult timeline to ensure that the animation remains accurate when chaining through multiple Projectile Motion Core SOPs.

title: Projectile Motion Core
summary: Shifts a collection of projectiles along physically accurate projectile paths.
